result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew John Godlewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Make all reasonable efforts to obtain and maintain full-time employment.  Full-time employment condition may be excused if defendant is paying $400/mo toward support and arrears.  Must comply with child support seek work order if not employed full-time.

records.addlTxt:
2:30 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Matthew John Godlewski in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  All parties acknowledge receipt of revocation packet.  Comments and recommendation by DA.  Response by Atty Lex.  Lex states that $2500 cash bond in case has been ordered forfeited, but not forfeited to date.  DA concurs.  Lex asks that the $2500 be sent for child support. and held open for 1 week to clear with DE's mother who posted money. Comments and summation by court.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

Ct 1 - 3.5 year prison, 1.5 years of initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision with 114 days credit for time served
Conditions of extended supervision
Pay child support arrearages in the amount of $56168.43 plus 10 % surcharge of $5616.84 for a total of $61785.27
Obtain and maintain full time employment of 32 hours a week at minimum wage.
Attend mental health services as directed by agent.
$268 cc
$250 DNAAS

Ct 2-4 - Sentence withheld - 4 years probation cs to prison sentence
Conditions of probation
$268 cc on each count
Obtain and maintain full time employment of 32 hours a week at minimum wage.
Attend mental health services as directed by agent.

Court provides written explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on August 4, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on July 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on July 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.

10:02 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Matthew John Godlewski appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE regarding right to attorney.  DE asks for representation.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  Matter adjourned to another day.
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2017 at 10:00 am.

11:17 am - DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Matthew John Godlewski not in court.  Atty James R Lex appears.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders warrant of $5000 plus execution fee, and orders the previous $2500 bond forfeited.  Adj. 11:20 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.
Sentencing hearing on November 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

1:18 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Matthew John Godlewski appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE was formerly represented by Lex.  DE would like representation.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  Hearing to be rescheduled.
Sentencing hearing on July 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
one certified copy returned from PRSO
9:33 am - Defendant Matthew John Godlewski not in court.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders warrant $2500 + execution fee. Adj. 9:33 am.

10:54 am - Defendant does not appear. Attorney James Richard Lex appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments by Attorney Lex regarding correspondence.  Court does not regard Attorney Lex as counsel on case. Court grants motion to enter judgment of conviction by default. Adj. 10:55 am.
Notice of motion and motion to enter JOC; Affidavit of Lisa Freeman

2:45 pm - Defendant Matthew John Godlewski appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA states agreement.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions DE regarding waiver form.  Court finds waiver given freely and accepts.  Parties have received and reviewed information and waives reading.  DE pleads NO CONTEST to Cts. 1-4.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Comments by parties.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 and defers entry of JOC on Cts. 2-4 and on motion of DA dismisses and reads-in Cts. 5-20 for purposes of restitution.  Exam by Court. Comments by Attorney Lex. Further exam by Court. Comments by defendant. Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 3:21 pm. 
Court imposes (Ct. 1):  
Sentence withheld - 3 years probation
Conditions:
$268 court costs
$250 DNAAS
Make all reasonable efforts to obtain and maintain full-time employment.  Full-time employment condition may be excused if defendant is paying $400/mo toward support and arrears
Must comply with child support seek work order if not employed full-time


(Cts. 2-4):
Deferred for a period of 8 years (see written order)

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.    DE may not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the Court.

Defendant Matthew John Godlewski appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
